name: MOSAIC.WAV
description: {{Nihongo|'''Mosaic.wav'''|モザイクウェブ|Mozaiku Webu}} (stylized '''MOSAIC.WAV''') is a Japanese [[moe (slang)|moe]]-[[pop music|pop]] band from [[Akihabara]], widely known for doing theme songs to [[eroge]], they eventually began to produce their own original work in 2004. In an interview with JaME, Kayamori stated their name was chosen in connection to church windows, and that they believe that the name really represents colour and different passions. The second half of the band's name refers to the digital sound file format [[WAV]]. Their songs have also been used as opening songs for ''[[Sumomomo Momomo]]'' and ''[[Kyouran Kazoku Nikki]]''. The band is fronted by vocalist MI-KO with Susumu Kayamori on keyboard and Masaya Koike on guitar.
